title: Need to ask question regarding a garnishment I received from my employer regarding an Autovest LLC judgment for a vehicle that
question: was repossessed in year 2009. I am in a slight panic due to payment is due to come out from my July 31, 2015 paycheck
answers: You can find the instructions here: http://www.socaladvocates.com/Bankruptcy/Stop-Wage-Garnishments-in-California.aspx

Several options you can immediately undertake.
-Fight the underlying judgment.
Possible attacks include, not limited to: improper service; lack of notice; lack of jurisdiction, other.
-File Claim of Exemption with levying agent.
-File C7 or C13 bankruptcy.
Immediately obtain from court that entered judgment copies of the entire case file. Particularly important documents include: complaint, proof of service, judgment
Bring all documents to BK counsel for review and plan of action to stop the garnishment and eliminate the debt.

Why did you not fight this before the court entered a judgment against you?

You need to go to the courthouse and get copies of the relevant documents, including the complaint, proof of service, judgment and other filings. Then consult an attorney right now. Today.

You can file a Claim of Exemption with the Sheriff if you need your wages to pay for necessities. The Sheriff gave your employer the forms that need to be completed. If you were not properly served with Summons and Complaint, you need to get a lawyer who can file a motion to set aside the default judgment. If you qualify, and have other financial problems, you can consider bankruptcy, either Chapter 7 or 13.

Usually, you fight the judgment before it is entered. Once it is entered, your choices are to make a payment arrangement with the creditor, settle for a lump sum of cash, or bankruptcy. Hope this perspective helps!
